title: Vegetable Fried Rice
steps: Heat sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add onion and garlic, and cook until fragrant.
Add carrots and peas, and stir-fry for 3-4 minutes until tender-crisp.
Add the cooked rice to the wok, breaking up any clumps.
Pour soy sauce over the rice and stir everything together until well combined.
Continue to stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until the rice is heated through.

title: Classic Chicken Alfredo
steps: Cook fettuccine according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
While pasta is cooking, season chicken with salt and pepper and cook in a skillet until golden brown and cooked through. Set aside and slice.
In the same skillet, melt butter over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant.
Pour in the heavy cream and bring to a simmer. Stir in Parmesan cheese until the sauce is smooth and thickened.
Add the cooked fettuccine and sliced chicken to the sauce, tossing to coat.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

title: Spicy Chicken Tacos
steps: In a skillet, cook shredded chicken with taco seasoning according to package directions.
Warm taco shells in the oven or microwave.
Assemble tacos by filling shells with the cooked chicken.
Top with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, and a dollop of sour cream.

title: Palak Paneer
steps: Blanch the spinach, then puree it and set aside.
In a pan, heat oil and sauté the onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add tomato puree, turmeric, and garam masala. Cook until oil separates from the masala.
Stir in the spinach puree and cook for 5 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and cream, simmer for another 2-3 minutes.
Serve hot with naan or rice.

title: Classic Beef Burger
steps: Form the ground beef into two patties. Season with salt and pepper.
Grill or pan-sear the patties for 4-5 minutes per side, or until cooked to your desired doneness.
During the last minute of cooking, place a slice of cheddar cheese on each patty to melt.
Toast the burger buns lightly.
Assemble the burgers with the patty, lettuce, tomato, and onion.
Add ketchup and mustard as desired.

title: Greek Salad
steps: In a large bowl, combine the chopped cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion.
Add the feta cheese and Kalamata olives.
In a small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, and oregano.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine.
Serve immediately.

title: Pad Thai
steps: Cook rice noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside.
Heat oil in a wok. Add tofu and cook until golden. Add shrimp and cook until pink. Remove and set aside.
Push ingredients to one side, crack eggs into the other side and scramble.
Return shrimp and tofu to the wok. Add noodles, bean sprouts, and Pad Thai sauce.
Toss everything together until well combined and heated through.
Serve topped with crushed peanuts and a lime wedge.

title: Mushroom Risotto
steps: In a large saucepan, melt butter and sauté onions until soft.
Add mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and start to brown.
Stir in the Arborio rice and cook for 1 minute until the grains are coated.
Pour in the white wine and cook until it's fully absorbed.
Add the warm vegetable broth one ladleful at a time, stirring continuously until each addition is absorbed before adding the next.
Continue until the rice is creamy and cooked al dente.
Stir in the Parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

title: Chicken Curry
steps: Heat oil in a pot and fry the onions until golden.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for a minute.
Add the chicken pieces and brown them on all sides.
Stir in the tomato puree, yogurt, and all the powdered spices.
Cook for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the chicken is cooked through and the gravy has thickened.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan.

title: Beef and Broccoli
steps: In a bowl, toss the sliced beef with cornstarch.
In a separate small bowl, mix soy sauce, ginger, and garlic.
Heat sesame oil in a wok. Add the beef and stir-fry until browned. Remove from wok.
Add broccoli to the wok with a little water, cover and steam for 3-4 minutes.
Return the beef to the wok, pour over the soy sauce mixture, and stir everything to combine.
Cook for another 2 minutes until the sauce has thickened slightly.
Serve over rice.

title: Margherita Pizza
steps: Preheat your oven to its highest setting, typically 500-550°F (260-290°C).
Stretch out the pizza dough on a lightly floured surface.
Spread a thin layer of tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a small border.
Arrange the fresh mozzarella slices on top.
Bake for 8-12 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly.
Remove from oven, top with fresh basil leaves, and drizzle with olive oil before slicing.

title: Vegetable Korma
steps: Boil or steam the mixed vegetables until tender. Set aside.
Make a paste of the soaked cashew nuts.
Heat oil in a pan, add the onion puree and ginger-garlic paste, and cook until golden.
Add the cashew paste and cook for a few minutes.
Stir in the yogurt, garam masala, and coriander powder. Cook until the gravy thickens.
Add the cooked vegetables and salt, simmer for 5-7 minutes.
Serve hot.

title: Lemon Herb Baked Salmon
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Place salmon fillets on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
In a small bowl, mix olive oil, dill, and garlic.
Brush the mixture over the salmon fillets.
Top each fillet with a few slices of lemon.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and flakes easily.
Serve immediately.

title: Guacamole
steps: Cut the avocados in half, remove the pits, and scoop the flesh into a bowl.
Mash the avocado with a fork to your desired consistency.
Stir in the lime juice, chopped onion, cilantro, and minced jalapeno.
Season with salt and mix well.
Serve with tortilla chips.

title: Lentil Soup
steps: Rinse the lentils.
In a large pot, heat olive oil and sauté the onion, carrot, and celery until softened.
Add the lentils, vegetable broth, cumin, and bay leaf.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 40-45 minutes, or until lentils are tender.
Remove the bay leaf before serving.

title: Spaghetti Carbonara
steps: Cook spaghetti according to package directions.
While the pasta cooks, sauté the pancetta in a skillet until crisp.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs and Pecorino Romano cheese.
Drain the pasta, reserving a little pasta water. Immediately add the hot pasta to the skillet with the pancetta.
Remove from heat and quickly stir in the egg and cheese mixture. The heat from the pasta will cook the eggs.
If the sauce is too thick, add a little of the reserved pasta water. Season generously with black pepper.

title: Tandoori Chicken
steps: Make deep gashes in the chicken pieces.
In a bowl, mix yogurt, tandoori masala, lemon juice, and ginger-garlic paste to make a marinade.
Coat the chicken pieces thoroughly with the marinade and let it rest for at least 4 hours, or overnight.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Arrange the chicken on a baking tray and bake for 25-30 minutes, turning once, until cooked through and charred in spots.
Serve with mint chutney and onion rings.

title: Ramen Noodle Soup
steps: Sear the pork belly until crispy. Then simmer in water for 30 minutes until tender. Slice.
In a pot, bring chicken broth to a simmer. Stir in soy sauce.
Cook ramen noodles according to package directions and drain.
Divide the noodles between two bowls. Pour the hot broth over them.
Top with sliced pork belly, a soft-boiled egg cut in half, and sliced green onions.

title: Macaroni and Cheese
steps: Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain.
In a saucepan, melt butter. Whisk in flour and cook for 1 minute to make a roux.
Gradually whisk in the milk until the sauce is smooth and bubbly.
Stir in the shredded cheddar cheese until melted and the sauce is creamy.
Combine the cheese sauce with the cooked macaroni.
Serve immediately.

title: Quesadillas
steps: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat.
Place one tortilla in the skillet. Sprinkle cheese (and chicken, if using) over the entire surface.
Top with the second tortilla.
Cook for 2-3 minutes per side, until the tortilla is golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Cut into wedges and serve with salsa and sour cream.

title: Hummus
steps: Combine chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, and garlic in a food processor.
Blend until smooth.
While the processor is running, slowly stream in the olive oil.
Continue to blend until the hummus is light and creamy.
Serve with pita bread or fresh vegetables.

title: Butter Chicken
steps: Marinate chicken in yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, and half the garam masala for at least 30 minutes.
Grill or pan-fry the chicken until cooked through. Set aside.
In a pot, melt butter. Add tomato puree and cook for 10 minutes.
Stir in the remaining garam masala and cook for another 2 minutes.
Reduce heat and slowly stir in the heavy cream.
Add the cooked chicken to the sauce and simmer for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with naan bread.

title: Caprese Salad
steps: Arrange alternating slices of tomato and mozzarella on a platter.
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the slices.
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and extra virgin olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.

title: Chili Con Carne
steps: In a large pot, brown the ground beef with the chopped onion.
Drain off any excess fat.
Stir in the kidney beans, diced tomatoes, chili powder, and cumin.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for at least 1 hour, stirring occasionally.
Serve with toppings like shredded cheese, sour cream, and crackers.

title: Sushi Rolls (Maki)
steps: Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo rolling mat.
Spread a thin layer of sushi rice over the nori, leaving a small border at the top.
Arrange your fillings (cucumber, avocado, crab/salmon) in a line across the center of the rice.
Carefully roll the sushi tightly from the bottom up, using the bamboo mat to help shape it.
Moisten the top border of the nori to seal the roll.
Slice the roll into 8 pieces with a sharp, wet knife.
Serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and pickled ginger.

title: Falafel
steps: Drain the soaked chickpeas.
In a food processor, combine chickpeas, onion, parsley, cilantro, garlic, and cumin. Pulse until the mixture is finely chopped but not a paste.
Form the mixture into small balls or patties.
Heat oil in a deep pan to 350°F (175°C).
Fry the falafel in batches for 3-5 minutes, until golden brown and crisp.
Serve in pita bread with tahini sauce and salad.

title: Chicken Enchiladas
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a bowl, mix the shredded chicken with half the cheese and the chopped onion.
Pour a small amount of enchilada sauce in the bottom of a baking dish.
Warm the tortillas briefly to make them pliable. Fill each tortilla with the chicken mixture, roll it up, and place it seam-side down in the baking dish.
Pour the remaining enchilada sauce over the tortillas and top with the rest of the cheese.
Bake for 20-25 minutes, until bubbly and heated through.

title: Aloo Gobi
steps: Heat oil in a pan and add cumin seeds. Once they splutter, add the chopped onion and sauté until golden.
Add the chopped tomato, turmeric, and coriander powder. Cook until the tomatoes are soft.
Add the potatoes and cauliflower, and mix well to coat with the spices.
Cover and cook on low heat for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender.
Garnish with cilantro and serve.

title: Pesto Pasta
steps: Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain, reserving a little pasta water.
In a large bowl, combine the hot pasta with the basil pesto and cherry tomatoes.
Toss to combine, adding a splash of the reserved pasta water to loosen the sauce if needed.
Serve immediately, topped with Parmesan cheese.

title: BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich
steps: Season the pork shoulder with salt and pepper.
Place in a slow cooker. In a bowl, mix BBQ sauce, apple cider vinegar, and brown sugar. Pour over the pork.
Cook on low for 6-8 hours, or on high for 4 hours, until the pork is very tender.
Remove the pork from the slow cooker and shred it with two forks.
Return the shredded pork to the sauce in the slow cooker and stir to combine.
Serve the pulled pork on hamburger buns.

title: Tom Yum Soup
steps: In a pot, bring 4 cups of water to a boil. Add lemongrass, galangal, and kaffir lime leaves.
Simmer for 10 minutes to infuse the flavors.
Add the mushrooms and shrimp, and cook until the shrimp turn pink.
Stir in the fish sauce, lime juice, and chili paste.
Serve hot.

title: Baba Ghanoush
steps: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Prick the eggplants with a fork and roast for 45-60 minutes, until the skin is wrinkled and the inside is very soft.
Let the eggplants cool, then scoop out the flesh and discard the skin.
In a bowl, mash the eggplant flesh with a fork.
Stir in the tahini, lemon juice, and garlic.
Garnish with chopped parsley and a drizzle of olive oil.

title: Dal Makhani
steps: Pressure cook the soaked lentils and kidney beans until they are very soft.
In a separate pan, melt butter and sauté the ginger-garlic paste.
Add the tomato puree and cook until the mixture thickens.
Add the cooked lentils and beans to the pan. Mash them slightly.
Simmer on low heat for at least 30 minutes, adding water as needed.
Stir in the heavy cream and garam masala, and cook for another 5 minutes.
Serve hot.

title: Lasagna
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Cook lasagna noodles. Brown ground beef and drain fat.
In a bowl, mix ricotta cheese with egg and half of the mozzarella.
Spread a layer of marinara sauce in a baking dish. Layer with noodles, ricotta mixture, meat sauce, and mozzarella.
Repeat the layers, ending with a layer of noodles, sauce, and the remaining mozzarella.
Bake for 45 minutes, until bubbly. Let it rest for 10 minutes before serving.

title: Shepherd's Pie
steps: Boil potatoes until tender, then mash with milk and butter.
In a skillet, brown the ground meat with onions and carrots.
Stir in beef broth and peas, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Spread the meat mixture in a baking dish. Top with the mashed potatoes.
Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 30 minutes, or until the top is golden brown.

title: Korean Bibimbap
steps: Marinate beef in soy sauce and sesame oil, then stir-fry until cooked.
Blanch the spinach, and sauté the carrots and zucchini separately.
Fry two eggs sunny-side up.
Assemble the bowls by placing a portion of rice at the bottom, then arranging the beef, vegetables, and a fried egg on top.
Serve with a dollop of gochujang.

title: Moussaka
steps: Salt the eggplant slices and let them sit to draw out moisture. Then fry or bake until golden.
Brown the ground lamb with onion. Stir in tomato sauce and simmer.
Make a béchamel sauce by melting butter, whisking in flour, then gradually adding milk. Season with nutmeg.
In a baking dish, layer the eggplant slices and meat sauce. Pour the béchamel sauce over the top.
Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45-60 minutes, until golden and bubbly.

title: Fajitas
steps: In a large skillet, cook the sliced chicken or steak until browned.
Add the bell peppers and onion to the skillet and cook until tender-crisp.
Stir in the fajita seasoning and a little water. Simmer for 5 minutes.
Warm the tortillas and serve with the meat and vegetable mixture.
Offer toppings like guacamole, salsa, and sour cream.

title: Samosas
steps: Make a firm dough with flour, water, and a little oil.
For the filling, heat oil and add cumin seeds. Then add mashed potatoes, peas, and spices. Cook for 5 minutes.
Roll out small discs from the dough, cut them in half, and form cones.
Fill the cones with the potato mixture and seal the edges.
Deep-fry the samosas on low heat until they are golden brown and crispy.

title: Gnocchi with Sage Butter Sauce
steps: Cook gnocchi in boiling salted water until they float to the surface. Drain.
In a skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the sage leaves and cook until the butter is browned and the sage is crispy.
Add the cooked gnocchi to the skillet and toss to coat in the sage butter sauce.
Serve immediately with a sprinkle of Parmesan cheese.

title: Clam Chowder
steps: Drain the clams, reserving the juice.
In a pot, cook the bacon until crisp. Remove bacon and set aside, leaving the fat in the pot.
Sauté onion and celery in the bacon fat until soft.
Add the potatoes and reserved clam juice. Bring to a boil and cook until potatoes are tender.
Stir in the half-and-half and clams. Heat through but do not boil.
Garnish with the cooked bacon.
